Here i go.  

1st try, i edited USB.IN_, USBPORT.IN_, USBSTOR.IN_, TXTSETUP.SIF, and added lines related to the usb drivers, so the windows setup would try to load them as "System Reserved" or "Boot Bus Estended".  

2nd try, i normally installed windows xp on my pendrive, then after the 1st reboot, when the windows asks to reboot, i got into my WinPE, loaded registry, and made the same changes manually, i edit the keys:  

HKLM,"SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\USBSTOR"  
HKLM,"SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\usbehci"  
HKLM,"SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\usbhub"  
HKLM,"SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\usbuhci"  
HKLM,"SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\usbohci"  

I change/add the entries:  
LoadOrderGroup = Boot Bus Extender  
StartType = 0

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Just for the record, the WinToFlash is actually NOT recommended (by me), as it is more or less a rip-off of the tools **wimb** and **ilko** developed, and does have some quirks, compare with: [http://www.msfn.org/...n-xp-with-win7/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/151516-dual-boot-win-xp-with-win7/ "External link") [http://www.msfn.org/...orp-wintoflash/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/137540-novicorp-wintoflash/ "External link") Since you already have a working PE of some kind - I presume on "pendrive 1", why don't you: * prepare/partition/format the "Pendrive 2" with RMPREPUSB * boot from "pendrive1" the PE * run from the PE the WINNT32.EXE with "pendrive 2" as target * apply marv's files (check the WHOLE thread, including cdob's addtitions/enhancements) * reboot from "pendrive 2" * report what happens
Generally speaking, DELL's are often a problem and sometimes (id depends on models) need the "modified" NTDETECT.COM, though normally the lack of it would produce a STOP 0x0000007b. Another thing, are you using an UNmodified XP source (possibly SP2)? Or are you using a modified one, possibly nlited or what not? On the other hand, if you are following (loosely) Tubo's tutorial on engine.de, there have been problems with copy and paste, in case use these files: [http://www.msfn.org/...es/page__st__23](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/119963-usb-booting-issues/page__st__23 "External link")
:smile: Wonko
